oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ephemera 2017.002 The Mansion
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ephemera 2017.002.001 The Mansion (booklet,13 pp.). House built in Tellico Plains in 1846 by Elisha Johnson (b. 1785 Vermont) on his property Tellico Iron Works. The Johnson family returned north in 1864. The Tellico Iron and Manufacturing Co. was purchased by W. A. Hoskins of Chattanooga. The property was later part of the W. C. Heyser Lumber Company and then the Babcock Lumber Company. Ephemera 2017.002.002: real photo post card of The Mansion, Tellico Plains, Tenn. by Roy Tuley Studio (P-100). RPPC 1 pc. Unused. Ephemera 2017.002.002: real photo post card (RPPC) of The Mansion, Tellico Plains, Tenn. by Roy Tuley Studio ( P-100). RPPC 1 pc. Unused.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Postcards; Pamphlets; Houses; Iron industry; Ephemera;
